## Convergence in distribution of sample extremes

Suppose that $X_1, X_2,...$ are iid random variables from a Pareto distribution with cdf 

$$
F(x) = \begin{cases}
1 - \left(\dfrac{1}{x} \right)^{\alpha} & x \geq 1\\
0 & x < 1
\end{cases}
$$
where $\alpha > 0$. Let $X_{(n)} = \max\{X_1,...,X_n\}$, and $Y_n = n^{-1/\alpha} X_{(n)}$. Show that as $n \to \infty$,

$$F_{Y_n}(t) \to e^{-t^{-\alpha}}$$

for all $t > 0$.
